page.title: 141985 BRADWELL CYCLE RIDE
page.content: The cycle ride this year took place on Sunday 7th July. About 140 cyclists turned up to pedal their way around the local countryside. As usual, the event took place in fancy dress. This year the theme was 'fairy tales'. The colourful procession was seen off by the mayor of Gt. Yarmouth at 11.00 am. An enthusiastic crowd clapped as each group of cyclists started. Lunch was taken at a pub in Somerleyton. Apart from a puncture in Goldilocks' rear tyre, there were no mishaps. The organisers are hoping to raise Â£3000 this year to buy a{C T scanner for the James Paget hospital in Gorleston. The ride is one of hundreds of fund-raising events for this vital piece of equipment designed to detect cancer. The scanner will cost Â£370,000 to buy and instal.
